Nameless corridor *spoilers*
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher EVO Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q & A: Nameless corridor *spoilers*
By Evolution75 on Wednesday, May 24, 2006 - 03:41 pm:

ok i beat moo and everything so how do i go to the nameless corridor(which is false advertisement because it does technicly have a name) i need just a few rares to complete my book and i can get the book cards there

By Slickriptide on Thursday, May 25, 2006 - 12:10 pm:

Caveat - I haven't tried it since I was pretty much just playing to get to the end of the story.

If you fast-forward a few weeks after the closing credits, the King and Queen of Warp World show up and tell you about the discovery of a hidden passage in the castle that emits frightening noises. Since Julio is Mr. Big-shot Monster Trainer, he naturally asks him to investigate.

I turned my game off at this point, but I assume that if you go to the schedule on the following week that you'll be able to schedule an adventure that will take you to the nameless corridor.

By kilak on Thursday, May 25, 2006 - 03:04 pm:

just a schedule an adventure
after beating the game every time you go on an adventure you will have the option to go to the nameless corridors first then if you say no you will go to the adventure for what ever town your in.
the difficulty of all adventures goes up in order
colno is the easiest (slightly tougher than warp in story) ascending to warp then nameless as the toughest
nameless has roughly 5 levels of difficulty and they are random . meaning the first map you see may very well have the toughest monsters you see instead of the normal 1st map easy last map hard pattern from the story adventures. you can see monsters with around 2300 health and jack in the cho's are far more dangerous here then anywhere else. after going through between 5-8 levels you will encounter a random uber boss. if yo ubeat him you can repeat the whole process again

By Apocalypse on Saturday, May 27, 2006 - 08:17 am:

By kilak on Saturday, May 27, 2006 - 12:38 pm:

storyline ends once you beat moo in warp.....
there are some story events that happen post credits but the rpg storyline is over at that point

By peter_poiuyt on Monday, June 5, 2006 - 02:44 pm:

2300 health? i've read somewhere that the enemy stats is based on your monsters' so did ya have a high life on yer monsters? i didn't raise my monsters' lif and the enemies have 1200 lif, on the last stage b4 the boss it was 2300 (the jack in the cho had like 1900) and the boss only had no more than 7k, almost 8k.

did ya ever get to beat a 2nd boss? was it tougher? i screwed up i hit the 1st boss 2 times, my monster missed?! an s in hit with lvl25acc and it missed! twice! then the boss used an all atk offed all my monsters. i shoulda used union but i forget i have it coz i only used it once, in the beginning of the game in the tutorial :D

By Ito Saith Webb on Wednesday, June 7, 2006 - 09:04 am:

From what I was able to discern is that the strength of the Nameless dungeon is in direct porortion to the stregnth of the town you are in. So if you are in one of the earlier towns the Nameless dungeon would be easier but a later town would be a tougher dungeon.

By Sardoochi on Monday, June 12, 2006 - 06:22 am:

By Scorpio Maurus on Wednesday, August 2, 2006 - 04:48 am:

The Nameless Cloister sucks bigtime in my opinion. I spent 4 hours there to beat it fighting tons of bosses. I had one monster maxed with 9,999 in every stat and it still took that long. After all that time you fight a red Moo and then the depressing warp chick with no personality shows up to talk with you. She is impressed that you made it that far and offers you a reward. Her stupid rewards are a L Power Gadget, L Intelligence Gadget, Rare Card or you can choose nothing and she'll tell you how noble you are. This is a seriously dissappointing reward for such hard work. She tells you a little more about how the warp people lost hope and then says that you must be tired and that she can use her magic to send you back to town and it's all over. Hours and Hours of fighting for nothing. So unless you really want to see a Red Glowing Moo with Orange Speckles all over him I don't suggest trying to beat the whole dungeon. Just get the cards you need and get out. But maybe there is someone out there who really wants to see a red Moo LOL who knows.
